quotes.message: Peace, like charity, begins at home.
quotes.name: Franklin D Roosevelt

quotes.message: I hate nobody: I am in charity with the world.
quotes.name: Jonathan Swift

quotes.message: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: He hath riches sufficient, who hath enough to be charitable.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Browne

quotes.message: Too many have dispensed with generosity in order to practice charity.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: Behold, I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give, I give myself.
quotes.name: Walt Whitman

quotes.message: Real progress is progress in charity, all other advances being secondary thereto.
quotes.name: Aldous Leonard Huxley

quotes.message: If you haven't got charity in your heart, you have the worst kind of heart trouble.
quotes.name: Bob Hope

quotes.message: The worst of charity is that the lives you are asked to preserve are not worth preserving.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Enrich my heart, mouth, hands in me, With faith, with hope, with charity, That I may run, rise, rest with Thee.
quotes.name: George Herbert

quotes.message: Defer not charities till death; for certainly, if a man weigh it rightly, he that doth so is rather liberal of another man's than of his own.
quotes.name: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.message: The primal duties shine aloft, like stars; The charities that soothe and heal and bless Are scattered at the feet of man like flowers.
quotes.name: William Wordsworth

quotes.message: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry and narrow-mindedness. Broad, wholesome, charitable views cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Let a man then know his worth, and keep things under his feet. Let him not peep or steal, or skulk up and down with the air of a charity-boy, a bastard, or an interloper.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Charity sees the need not the cause.
quotes.name: German Proverb

quotes.message: A bone to the dog is not charity. Charity is the bone shared with the dog, when you are just as hungry as the dog.
quotes.name: Jack London

quotes.message: Be charitable before wealth makes thee covetous.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Browne

quotes.message: The charity that hastens to proclaim its good deeds, ceases to be charity, and is only pride and ostentation.
quotes.name: William Hutton
